standard_metadata.standard_description: Find the area of right triangles, other triangles, special quadrilaterals, and polygons by composing into rectangles or decomposing into triangles and other shapes; apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.

images.alt: A 4-sided figure with one pair of parallel sides. One parallel side measures 7 meters and the other measures 8 meters. A 4 meter segment connects the parallel sides and is at a right angle to the 7-meter side.

hints.content: This figure is a quadrilateral with a pair of parallel sides (the top and bottom sides), so it's a trapezoid.
$\text{Area of a trapezoid} = \dfrac12 \cdot (b_1 + b_2) \cdot h$
Now use this formula to calculate the trapezoid's area.   $b_1 = 7$   $b_2 = 8$   $h = 4$   $A = \dfrac12 \cdot (7 + 8) \cdot 4 = 30$
